steps.title: Where can I find my gmail?

content.text: This is a link that will take you to your gmail account if you are logged in. Click the word ‘Gmail’ to see!
This is a link that if clicked on, will take you to Googles’ images search engine. There you can type anything in the search bar and Google will populate thousands of images of what you typed!
If you click on this 2-D array of dots, another menu of a list of applications that are linked to your Google account will pop up!
You can click on each of these icons, which are links, to explore what Google has to offer. Google provides applications such Youtube, Google calendar, Google maps, and a translator!
Click this small circle to see an enlarged image of your current profile picture. This image is made public to other gmail users.
From here you can change your profile picture by clicking the camera icon located towards the bottom right of your current profile picture.
From this menu you can also add another account.
Now that you know of all the plentiful features Google offers its users, all that’s left is to learn how to “Google it!”
Click in this large search bar and just type anything that you would like to know more about.
Then, press the enter key located on your keyboard, or click the magnifying glass to the left of the search bar to search for thousands of websites that are related to your topic.
That’s it! You have successfully completed the walkthrough and learned about all the resources Google provides as well as how to “Google it!”  Enjoy Googling! :)
